author: blair
msg: * subversion/libsvn_diff/diff_file.c
(svn_diff__file_datasource_open) and (svn_diff3_file_output):
Work around an assert-style core dump in code compiled by the GCC
bounds checking compiler when a NULL pointer is used in pointer
arithmetic.
Get consistent capitalization in error messages.

author: sussman
msg: Review from gstein:  tighten up the still-disabled export editor code.
* export.c (struct dir_baton): remove unused 'props' field.  remove
'parent' field.
(struct handler_baton): remove useless 'src'/'dest' fields.  change
'fb' field to 'tmppath'.
(window_handler): hb->fb is gone, use tmppath.
(apply_textdelta): simplify by using svn_stream_empty().  No need
for separate handler_pool either.  No need to init apr_file_t to NULL.
(open_root, add_directory):  db->parent no longer exists.  in
open_root, return OBSTRUCTED_UPDATE error if dir already exists.
that means we don't need to do existence checks anywhere else.

author: kfogel
msg: As of revision 5618, repositories and working copies now use
README.txt instead of README, and they use local eol style in those
files.  This revision makes the analogous change to
~/.subversion/README, and adjusts the book for all of these changes
(thanks to Mike Pilato for reminding me of the docs):
* subversion/libsvn_subr/config_impl.h
(SVN_CONFIG__USR_README_FILE): Add .txt extension.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/config_file.c
(svn_config_ensure): Use APR_EOL_STR instead of "\n".
* doc/book/book/ch05.xml, doc/book/book/ch06.xml,
doc/book/book/ch08.xml: Use the new filenames.

author: kfogel
msg: Fix issue #1232: use `README.txt' instead of `README' in both the
repository and the .svn areas (since Windows prefers the former and
Unix is neutral), and use the local eol style in the file.  While
we're at it, also switch to local eol style for the repository hook
templates.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/repos.h
(SVN_REPOS__README): Add the ".txt" extension.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc.h
(SVN_WC__ADM_README): Add the ".txt" extension.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/repos.c
(create_repos_structure, create_hooks): Use APR_EOL_STR instead of "\n".
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_files.c
(init_adm): Use APR_EOL_STR instead of "\n".

author: sussman
msg: Followup to r5516, issue #1090 ("'svn cp URL wc' must notice foreign UUID").
In r5516, in the directory case, we decided that a foreign UUID meant
"don't do a checkout and add-with-history, but instead do an export
and straightforward add."  But this logic is flawed;  'svn export'
doesn't get properties.
So for now, in the foreign-UUID directory case, we're going to bail
and return SVN_ERR_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE.  See the comment in the code.
* libsvn_client/copy.c (repos_to_wc_copy): don't support a dirURL->wc
copy if the UUID is foreign.
* copy_tests.py (repos_to_wc):  make regression test expect failure in
the directory case.
